newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Notionnel to hesitate, resistance 131.24.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Notionnel to hesitate, resistance 131.24.

text.p: September notionnel futures on MATIF will remain steady on Thursday, but the longer-term trend is positive, technical analysts said.
"The contract is basically consolidative, within the core of its uptrend," said Elli Gifford, independent technical analyst near Cambridge.
Gifford put resistance around the contract high of 131.24 reached on daily charts on July 23. Before that, resistance kicked in at 131.20, she said.
September notionnel futures were trading at 130.92 at 0708 GMT, down 0.04.
Jim Dodgin, senior technical analyst at Technical Data in London, saw the contract stuck in a 130.90-131.10 range on Thursday.
"I cannot really see too much happening before the non-farm payrolls on Friday. There is a slight bias to the upside, but it is capped by the contract high."
On the downside, Dodgin found rising trendline support at 130.70. "Unless that breaks, there is no point being short."
Gifford saw support at 130.60, and below there at 130.40. The contract hit a high of 130.60 on Monday on daily charts, and reached a low of 130.40 in the same session.
"You cannot really see a lot of activity. The notionnel has a bit of a similar picture to the Bund, but I prefer the Bund," said Gifford.
At the short end, September PIBOR futures were unchanged on the day at 96.52.
